column3: How do I win a kidnapping fight?
column4: To win, you must break your opponent's willpower before getting yours broken yourself.  The first to break will submit, and then their arms can be restrained.
Both kidnappers attack at the same time and can perform any one of four moves.  Each move has strengths and weaknesses against other moves.
We call them the "BDSM" moves, they are: Brute force, Domination, Sneakiness, and Manipulation.

Brute force is about using physical strength and endurance against your opponent.  You can slap, kick, punch, and choke, but don't go too far.
Brute force is good versus Domination, fair versus Manipulation, and bad versus Sneakiness.  Brute force is halved if clothes are removed.

Domination is good versus Manipulation, fair versus Sneakiness, and bad versus Brute force.  Domination is halved when collared.

Sneakiness is good versus Brute force, fair versus Domination, and bad versus Manipulation.  Sneakiness is halved if the feet are restrained.

Manipulation is good against Sneakiness, fair against Brute force, and bad against Domination.  Manipulation is halved if you're gagged.
